snippet: A woman was approached on the street and attacked, but the defense lawyer for Michael Pena says it was not a predatory sexual assault.
abstract: Defense attorney for New York City Police Officer Michael Pena, on trial for rape, admits to jurors in opening statement that his client did assault a woman in Upper Manhattan while he was off duty and out of uniform, but says that he is not guilty of the most serious charge, predatory sexual assault, which could send him to prison for life.
lead_paragraph: A woman was approached on the street and attacked, but the defense lawyer for Michael Pena says it was not a predatory sexual assault.

headline.seo: Defense Concedes a Lot in Rape Case of Police Officer Michael Pena
headline.main: Facts Conceded at Officer’s Rape Trial
headline.print_headline: Facts Conceded at Officer’s Rape Trial
